title: Kundika
text: According to Buddhist iconographical texts, the bodhisattva Avalokitesvara holds a long-necked vase or <I>kundika<I> from which the "water of life" is dispensed. Similarly, Buddhist priests sprinkle worshippers as a form of ritual ablution. The vessel is refilled using the hinged spout on the shoulder. The elegant shape of the <I>kundika<I> was so admired during the Koryo dynasty that potters also produced celadon vessels for decorative use among the aristocracy.
description: rounded body supporting a tall neck tapering to domed disk surrounded by a thin faceted sprinkling spout; set at one side with a tall waisted spout and attached lid. Koryo dynasty.
